msgSnippet: I am currently involved in a large J2EE project. We are using the Struts framework w/ JSP to implement the presentation and controller functions of our system.

I am currently involved in a large J2EE project. We are using the Struts
framework w/ JSP to implement the presentation and controller functions of
our system. The business logic is implemented with a combination of regular
Java classes and stateless session beans (EJBs). The EJBs communicate with
"DAO" classes which abstract all access to our back end database.

We have figured out what we believe is a good way to unit test our EJBs and
DAOs. However, we are struggling with unit testing the presentation layer
(JSPs, Struts action objects, etc.). We considered HttpUnit, however, it
does not handle Javascript, and our JSP pages will make fairly heavy use of
Javascript for client-side validation.

I'd appreciate hearing of any technologies or ideas you have for unit
testing of web-based applications.

Thanks,
Matt Humphrey
subject: Options for unit testing JSP pages
